articles.image_title: BRUSSELS, BELGIUM - FEBRUARY 28: Czech Minister of Industry and Trade Jozef Sikela is talking to media in the Europa, the EU Council headquarter on February 28, 2022 in Brussels, Belgium. Following the invasion of Ukraine by Russian forces, EU energy ministers will convene in Brussels to discuss the current situation of the energy market in Europe. The Russian invasion of Ukraine has caused an increase in the price of gas in the EU and in global oil prices. This increase is happening in the context of a pre-existing spike in energy prices in the EU. (Photo by Thierry Monasse/Getty Images)
